subject: Communication
title: Touch: From Handshakes to Hugs
description: A 60-second lesson on Touch: From Handshakes to Hugs.

hook.text: A French colleague kisses both cheeks in greeting. An Indian colleague presses palms together.

buildup.text: Touch norms vary enormously: Mediterranean and Latin cultures are high-touch; East Asian and Northern European.

discovery.text: Greeting rituals encode cultural values. Bowing (humility), handshaking (equality), cheek-kissing (warmth), namaste.

twist.text: The COVID pandemic disrupted greeting norms worldwide. Elbow bumps, foot taps, and hand-over-heart replaced physical.

climax.text: Getting the greeting wrong creates an awkward first impression. Getting it right signals cultural awareness instantly.

punchline.text: How you say hello says everything about what you respect.

quiz.question: Which cultures are typically classified as 'high-touch'?
